author: Andy Chalk
description: Early 2026, though, so that's not so bad.
title: 13 years after it was first teased, and 2 months after committing to a 2025 release, Mewgenics is delayed into 2026

description: You just need to actually find one before you can test the theories.
title: Elden Ring Nightreign has an ultra-rare item with a 0.035% chance to drop and players are convinced it's the key to the game's biggest secret

description: I love Kojima's games, but we don't need to hear about his genius every five seconds.
title: I love Hideo Kojima's games, but last night's fawning over his genius from Geoff Keighley and the Death Stranding 2 cast got me the opposite of hyped

author: Andy Chalk
description: Agent 47 is an "empty shell," while Bond is anything but.

description: Marvel at The Rig's high-end specs in full here

description: I don't know what any of this is but I know I love looking at it.

description: The Beast is not the standalone expansion I thought it'd be.

description: Ah, sweet memories.

author: Harvey Randall
description: Do what you love, and you'll never work a day in your life.
title: Even when he's meant to be talking about watches, Henry Cavill's downright giddy over producing Warhammer 40k's upcoming Amazon series, says it's 'a challenge I'm enjoying enormously'

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Xbox is becoming more like PC and Windows is becoming more like Xbox... is Microsoft looking to muscle SteamOS out of the way?

description: Kelpie has the equestrian community seal of approval so far.

description: I'm not sure playtime always equates to enjoyment.
title: Randy Pitchford has concluded that 'Borderlands 3 is better than Borderlands 2' after looking at a Twitter poll, but Borderlands 4 will be the best, for sure

author: Nick Evanson
description: Clean, woody, and aquatic. Doesn't shout 'gamer' to me.
title: It's not an April Fool's joke anymore: Zotac goes ahead with its 'gamer fragrance' perfume, for a limited few, for a limited time

author: Fraser Brown
description: All we got from Bethesda this year was fishing. Not a vampire in sight.

description: Gambits, my beloved.
title: Turn-based RPGs are officially back in fashion, but I want more: It's time for modern developers to take another pass at FF12's gambit system

description: Lovely earbuds for almost everything except gaming.
title: Nothing Ear (a) review

description: No MSI RDNA 4 cards means no MSI RDNA 4 hardware for the Afterburner dev.
title: 'MSI Afterburner is a bit PowerColor Afterburner now' as the dev had to buy another manufacturer's GPU to build support for AMD's RDNA 4 graphics cards into the next beta

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Just in case you were a little dismayed to head back to Inaba.

author: Elie Gould
description: Leon's never too far away from the action.
title: Move over Ashcroft, Resident Evil 9 will have its T-virus poster boy back in the limelight according to notable Resi leaker: 'Leon Kennedy is not the only playable character but he is the main character'

author: Robert Jones
description: A great opening to a grippingly weird new fantasy RPG
title: I grabbed the free demo of dark new fantasy RPG The Fall of Avalon: Tainted Grail and, boy, does it take Bethesda back to school

author: Nick Evanson
description: The key detail here is that not all motherboard fan headers are the same.
title: Lian Li's new Hydroshift AIO cooler doesn't work properly on some motherboards but it will send you a replacement part if you can't get around the issue in the BIOS

author: Jacob Ridley
description: You won't need to buy an Xbox-branded handheld to benefit from the new UI on Windows devices.
title: Xbox is headed to handhelds but its gaming-first UI will also land on existing ROG Ally and ROG Ally X and 'other Windows handhelds starting next year'

author: Harvey Randall
description: Trailer? Uh, best we can do is a mention in an unrelated handheld ad.
title: Of course, Team Cherry didn't deign to tell anyone that Hollow Knight: Silksong is arriving before Christmas in a weekend of showcases—but via a random Discord message

description: There are more than a few things on the cutting room floor.

author: Nick Evanson
description: Glue and stickers akimbo, with too many bits soldered directly to the main motherboard.
title: Switch 2 teardown shows that Nintendo hasn't learned a single lesson from the OG Switch when it comes to repairing it

author: Wes Fenlon
description: A little bit Zelda and a little bit Gang Beasts, Awaysis is trying to make physics-based combat way punchier.
title: Awaysis, from the makers of the underrated Galak-Z, was inspired by the slapstick physics action of Gang Beasts having one glaring omission—it needed a giant sword

description: They're boasting an ecosystem that reacts to your presence.
